paper_abstract: Using a theoretical framework inspired by Pierre Bourdieu and Hope Olson, the discursive space of the Canadian bilingual cataloguing system is examined for its application of subject headings to documents which discuss Quebec as a distinct society. A historical warrant for this status is presented along with an overview of the principles underlying the development of and relationship between the Canadian Subject Headings and the French-language vocabulary Repertoire de vedettes-matiere. Through the use of specific examples, bilingual equivalencies pertaining to people, identity, history, and society are discussed.
paper_title: Bilingual Conundrums: A Study of the Use of Subject Headings Pertaining to Quebec as a Distinct Society
